Package dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.itemspawn

Class Feast

java.lang.Object
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.BaseEvent
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.itemspawn.BaseItemSpawn
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.itemspawn.Feast
public class Feast extends BaseItemSpawn
A positive event that spawns random weighted food items near players. Food items have different spawn weights, with rarer items having lower weights. The items are spawned within configured radius limits and following specific spawn rules.

  • Constructor Details

    • Feast

      public Feast()
      Constructs a new Feast event with predefined spawn configurations and weighted food items. The event is classified as POSITIVE and named "feast". Initializes spawn parameters including: - 32 items per spawn - Spawn radius between 1-20 blocks - Vertical spawn range between 1-10 blocks - Various food items with weights from 0.5 (rarest) to 5.0 (most common)

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the Feast event, spawning configured food items near players. Calls the parent class's execute method to handle the actual spawning logic.
      Overrides:
      execute in class BaseItemSpawn

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the Feast event, cleaning up any ongoing processes. Calls the parent class's terminate method to handle the cleanup.
      Overrides:
      terminate in class BaseItemSpawn
